newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Adobe, Sprint gain.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Adobe, Sprint gain.

text.p: Adobe Systems Inc shares ascended sharply early Wednesday on buying inspired by the company's report of strong financial performance in the second quarter ended February 28, traders said.
Adobe shares were very active at 39, up from yesterday's last Nasdaq trade of 34-7/8.

The print and electronic media software company said last night it earned $0.63 per share in fiscal second quarter versus $0.44 per one year ago. The Wall Street analysts' consensus earnings estimate for the period was $0.51 per share, according to Zack's Investment Research.

Further supporting the shares was the Adobe's announcment that it intends to pay investors a dividend from time to time based on profits derived from the selling of stock in other public companies Adobe holds.
Also, Morgan Stanley upgraded the stock to outperform from neutral this morning.
Sprint Corp also rallied, rising to 47 from 43-1/8 on a Wall Street Journal report that Britain's Cable and Wireless Plc is interested in buying Sprint.
The companies have declined to comment on the speculation.
Within the same industry group, MCI Communications Corp traded up in lock-step with merger partner British Telecommunications, traders said.
They said British Telecomm shares are gaining on reports that it will soon unveil a joint venture with Telefonica de Espana SA to extend its reach in the Americas.
Before the bell, MCI rose to 38-3/8 from 36-7/8.
British Telecomm's New York Stock Exchange-traded shares also climbed before the open, to 73-1/2 from 70-5/8.
Other shares active before the open included Cisco Systems off 2-3/8 to 48, 3Com, down to 32-5/8 from 33-3/4, Microsoft off 1-5/8 to 98 and WorldCom up 3/8 to 24.
